messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] dirt
messages.msgSnippet: Wow, I thought that the kidlets were dirt magnets and that they were simply helping me to fill up my raised beds.  You mean I ve been doing it wrong all these
messages.messageBody:
Wow, I thought that the kidlets were dirt magnets and that they were simply
helping me to fill up my raised beds. You mean I've been doing it wrong
all these years. I'm not suppose to be hosing them off in the garden? I'm
suppose to bring them INSIDE and, and, yipes clean them and their clothes
off?? No, tell me it ain't so!

Lynda

----------
> >From: Aaron Nathaline Shonk <shonkfamily@...>
> >Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> >To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> >Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] dirt
> >Date: Mon, 5 Jun 2000 21:29:48 -0700
> >
> ><That's what my days look like with my 2 and 3 year olds. Except you
> >left out the part about dirt, brushing dirt off them, <wiping dirt off
> >them, shaking dirt out of their clothes, brushing dirt off me, washing
> >dirt off everyone with the hose, <pounding dirt out of shoes, etc.
Maybe
> >that is just a circumstance of having boys though. LOL
> >
> >Nanci,
> >
> >What - do you mean I am supposed to clean the dirt off my kids? No
> >wonder we get so many strange looks...<G>
> >
> >Nathaline Shonk

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] dirt
messages.messageBody:
Oh stop! You girls are crackin' me up. :) :) :)

Marcy
